item.title: ABN AMRO And Rabobank Ramp Up Blockchain Initiatives
item.description:
ABN AMRO And Rabobank Ramp Up Blockchain Initiatives

Typically, financial institutions wait for a new technology to mature before investing in it. Blockchain technology, because of the impact it is expected to bring to the financial industry, is a different matter, as witnessed by the number of financial institutions investing in blockchain experimentation.

item.title: Craig Wright Will Move Satoshi's Bitcoins "Soon"
item.description:
Craig Wright Will Move Satoshi's Bitcoins "Soon"

The recent outing of Craig Wright as being Bitcoin creator Satoshi Nakamoto has been a source of considerable controversy among Bitcoin community members over the past 24 hours. With less than conclusive evidence, there is a growing demand for more verification. By the look of things, Wright will provide exactly that, or so he claims, at least.

item.title: Deloitte Unveils 5 Blockchain Partnerships and 20 Prototypes - CoinDesk
item.description:
Deloitte Unveils 5 Blockchain Partnerships and 20 Prototypes - CoinDesk

One of the largest accounting firms in the world, Deloitte, says it has partnered with five blockchain startups and built a wide range of prototypes to service industries including insurance, employee management, and cross-border payments. The 'Big Four' accounting firm has built 20 working blockchain prototypes in partnership with startups BlockCypher, Bloq, ConsenSys Enterprise, Loyyal and Stellar.

item.title: Question regarding the number of bytes in an OP_RETURN transaction
item.description:
Question regarding the number of bytes in an OP_RETURN transaction

Bitcoin Stack Exchange is a question and answer site for Bitcoin crypto-currency enthusiasts. It's 100% free, no registration required. Sign up Here's how it works: Anybody can ask a question Anybody can answer The best answers are voted up and rise to the top I was reading this very useful explanation of what an OP_RETURN transaction looks like and got tripped up by part of it.

item.title: Post-Trade Distributed Ledger Group Grows Membership to 37 Financial Firms - CoinDesk
item.description:
Post-Trade Distributed Ledger Group Grows Membership to 37 Financial Firms - CoinDesk

The Post-Trade Distributed Ledger (PTDL) Group, an initiative launched last year by banks, clearing houses and exchanges, has taken steps to formalize its operations and make clear its memberships and organization. Announced today, the PTDL Group now has 37 financial institutions as members, with its organization committee being composed of CME Group, Euroclear, HSBC, the London Stock Exchange and UniCredit.

item.title: New Europol Powers May Lead to Blockchain Analysis Task Force
item.description:
New Europol Powers May Lead to Blockchain Analysis Task Force

Bitcoin has been referred to as a tool that makes it easier for terrorist groups to acquire funding. The recently-acquired enhanced cyber powers by Europol may be used to crack down on Bitcoin and blockchain.

item.title: IBM Launches Highly Secure Blockchain Service on Cloud
item.description:
IBM Launches Highly Secure Blockchain Service on Cloud

The idea of combining blockchain services and a cloud operating environment has always been desired, but was held back due to security concerns in the past. By launching blockchain services that meet the latest security standards on the cloud, IBM has just mitigated those concerns.

item.title: The CSIRO is exploring Bitcoin's blockchain technology
item.description:
The CSIRO is exploring Bitcoin's blockchain technology

Announced as part of the 2016 federal budget, the government will be encouraging its agencies as well as private companies to explore blockchain technology. The government's downsized CSIRO research body Data61 will lead the country's blockage development. "The Government will encourage the exploration of Blockchain technology, including through a study and pilot testing by the CSIRO's Data61," it said in the budget.

item.title: Bitcoin Inventor 'Satoshi Nakamoto' Finally Revealed
item.description:
Bitcoin Inventor 'Satoshi Nakamoto' Finally Revealed

The inventor of the digital currency bitcoin has finally been revealed, according to an interview with several media outlets and a blog post written by the man himself. Australian entrepreneur Craig Wright has told the BBC that he is Satoshi Nakamoto, the shadowy creator of the cryptocurrency, in a move that is likely to end the years-old search for the inventor.
